hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Volume-Price Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regime with price between 50-day and 100-day SMA, a 3-day period of declining volume on up-days and increasing volume on down-days signals distribution and transition to BEAR regime with 67% probability within 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volume-price divergence during neutral periods reveals institutional distribution. Weak volume on rallies and strong volume on declines indicates selling pressure accumulating beneath the surface.
entry_conditions: 3-day volume pattern: declining volume on green days, increasing volume on red days
Cumulative volume delta negative over 3 days

exit_conditions.take_profit: Short position: 4% profit OR regime changes to BEAR
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% loss OR daily close above 50-day SMA with volume surge

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals fail to transition to BEAR OR result in false breakdowns with quick recovery
